lines.text:
[invisible]
You know something, Alice?
What?
If you were blind, we'd make the perfect couple.

[reading Nick's record]
Never been married, parents both deceased... the guy's got a few friends, but not real close to any of them. Not exactly a workaholic, either. He kind of plays it fast and loose.

I've dealt with people like this before. No close personal ties, no strong political beliefs, no particular interests... in fact, when you think about it, the man has the perfect profile. He was invisible *before* he was invisible.
[Nick is invisible]
How am I going to explain this to my mother?
Just tell her that you met someone, you really like him, you think it's serious, he's transparent...
[last lines]
Son of a bitch
Now you listen to me, you son of a bitch. I've lost everything but my soul, and you're not going to take that away from me.

Perhaps a small reminder of the state of things is in order. I'm the one who kills people, Warren, not you. And if you screw up with me, I will cut off your testicles, I will lightly fry them, and Morrissey here...
[indicates Morrissey]
Will have them for lunch.
I want my molecules back!
[to Nick who has become invisible]
It's lonely, isn't it, when you're a freak?
[sucking on her finger]
There's really only a few places in the Amazon that could still be considered virgin.
Why are you doing this to me? All I know is that he exists.
And that's already too much.
I often sit in the dark wondering what it must've been like, were you conscious? Did you feel any pain? Did you feel yourself changing?
You found your calling Nick.

[narrating]
I was a fugitive, afraid of getting caught. I kept imagining Jenkins leaping out at me from every dark corner. As a child, I would dream about being invisible. I thought it would be so easy. I could do what I want, go where I want and take what I want. But that's the catch. No matter how hungry I was, I couldn't give myself away.
